sentence.Network_en: Early American weathervanes were most often cut from flat wooden boards.

sentence.Network_en: A Delta II rocket was launched from Cape Canaveral early this morning.
sentence.Network_cn: 今天一早，一枚“德尔塔”Ⅱ型火箭在卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

jx.jx_en_mean: not before the time or date specified
(humorous)a person who rises, arrives, or acts before the usual or expected time
jx.jx_cn_mean: (幽默)早起的鸟儿（指早起者、早到者或捷足先登者）

phrase.cizu_name: the early bird catches the worm

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)the person who takes the earliest opportunity to do something will gain the advantage over others
jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)早起的鸟儿有虫吃，捷足者可先得

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)early on, especially in a game or contest
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)（尤指比赛或竞赛中的）最初阶段；一开始

lj.lj_ly: you should try to wind up their star player early doors.
lj.lj_ls: 你应该一开始就设法使对方明星队员处于高度紧张状态。

lj.lj_ly: he worked himself into an early grave.

jx.jx_en_mean: the time after midnight and before dawn
an occasion when someone goes to bed before the usual time, especially in order to catch up on sleep
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为弥补睡眠时间而比平时）睡得早的晚上

jx.jx_en_mean: at an early (or earlier) stage in a particular time or period

lj.lj_ly: they discovered early on that the published data were wrong.
lj.lj_ls: 他们早就发现所公布的数据是错的。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly Brit. )it is too soon to be sure how a situation will develop

lj.lj_ly: it's still early days for the initiative.
lj.lj_ls: 现在采取主动为时尚早。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English (as an adverb) ǣrlīce (see ere, -ly), influenced by Old Norse árliga. The adjective use dates from Middle English

entry.tran: （指在通常的时间之前）早,提早,提前
entry.def: Early means before the usual time that a particular event or activity happens.

example.ex: I knew I had to get up early...
Why do we have to go to bed so early?
example.tran: 为什么我们那么早就得上床睡觉？

entry.def: Early means near the beginning of a day, week, year, or other period of time.

example.tran: 在20世纪70年代以及80年代早期

entry.tran: （指在原定或预计的时间之前）早，提早,提前
entry.def: Early means before the time that was arranged or expected.

example.ex: She arrived early to secure a place at the front...
example.tran: 为了能占个靠前的位置，她提早到了。

example.ex: The first snow came a month earlier than usual.
example.tran: 第一场雪比往年提早了一个月。

entry.tran: （历史时期或事物存续期）早期的,初期的
entry.def: Early means near the beginning of a period in history, or in the history of something such as the world, a society, or an activity.
Early means near the beginning of something such as a piece of work or a process.
Early refers to plants which flower or crop before or at the beginning of the main season.

example.tran: 这些早熟卷心菜和花椰菜

entry.def: Early reports or indications of something are the first reports or indications about it.

example.tran: 开初的迹象看起来令人鼓舞。

example.ex: Earlier reports that troops opened fire are now being denied.
example.tran: 有关军队开火的最初传闻现在遭到了否认。

entry.def: You can use as early as to emphasize that a particular time or period is surprisingly early.

example.ex: Inflation could fall back into single figures as early as this month.
example.tran: 通货膨胀率最早有可能在本月就回落至个位数。

entry.def: If you say about something that might be true that it is early days, you mean that it is too soon for you to be completely sure about it.

example.ex: The chances of Francis eventually becoming manager of England are perhaps higher. It is early days, of course, and he has yet to win anything.
example.tran: 弗朗西斯最终成为英格兰队主教练的几率可能更高。当然，现在这样说为时尚早，他还没赢过呢。

means.word_mean: 1. at or near the beginning of a period of time or course of events or before the usual or expected time;

sentences.sentence: "early varieties of peas and tomatoes mature before most standard varieties"

means.word_mean: 2. being or occurring at an early stage of development;
5. of an early stage in the development of a language or literature;

sentences.sentence: "the Early Hebrew alphabetical script is that used mainly from the 11th to the 6th centuries B.C."
"Early Modern English is represented in documents printed from 1476 to 1700"
"look for an early end to the negotiations"

means.word_mean: 2. before the usual time or the time expected;

sentences.sentence: "the house was completed ahead of time"

list.explanation: (黑人用语)现代的，时新的，最新的

example.en: All our information is kept right early on the computer.
example.zh: 我们贮存在计算机中的所有信息都是最新的。

auth_sentence.content: Early intervention is essential for those with eating disorders.
auth_sentence.res_content: Early intervention is essential for those with eating disorders.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Early intervention is essential for those with eating disorders.

auth_sentence.content: There have been many late nights and early starts.
auth_sentence.res_content: There have been many late nights and early starts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There have been many late nights and early starts.

auth_sentence.content: The crickets may have been hunted by early mammals.
auth_sentence.res_content: The crickets may have been hunted by early mammals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The crickets may have been hunted by early mammals.

sentences.en: Please reply at your earliest convenience.
sentences.cn: 请在您方便时尽早答复。

sentences.en: Sorry, I can't be here so early.
sentences.cn: 对不起, 我不能那么早到这里。

sentences.en: Man early discovered the use of fire.
sentences.cn: 古时候人们就发现了火的用途。

jushi.english: His genius as a painter flowered very early.
jushi.chinese: 他作为画家的才华很早就显露出来了。

jushi.english: He got up exceedingly early this morning.
jushi.chinese: 他今天早晨起得非常早。
